author: Special Correspondent
text:
A team of officials from revenue and other departments inspected the Mookaneri Lake in the city limits and held discussion on preventing the mixing of drainage with the lake water.

The sprawling Mookaneri Lake is brimming to its capacity, thanks to the widespread rainfall received by the district in the last two months.

Drainage

The district administration received complaints about encroachments in the lake and also about the mixing of drainage with the lake water.

Following this, a team of revenue and Corporation officials led by C. Vijaybabu, Revenue Divisional Officer (RDO), inspected the Mookaneri Lake and its bunds recently. The officials from the forest, horticulture, Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board, Town panchayats farmed part of the team.

The official inspected the park on the bank of the tank, walkers track, view point, the supplying channel, the drainage let out by the Corporation and the Kannankurichi town panchayat etc. The RDO directed the officials to take immediate steps to check the mixing of drainage with the lake water.

He also directed the officials to study the feasibility of setting up a sewage water treatment plant.
title: Officials inspect Mookaneri Lake
